data.name: Total RNA Isolation from Human Blood using TRIzol Reagent
data.description: A detailed protocol for isolating total RNA from human blood samples using TRIzol reagent, including quality control steps and recommendations for optimal yield
data.intendedUse: This protocol is designed for efficient isolation of high-quality total RNA from fresh or frozen human blood samples, suitable for downstream applications including RNA-Seq, RT-qPCR, and microarray analysis
data.ethicalLegalSocial: Human blood samples must be collected following appropriate ethical guidelines and informed consent procedures. Biosafety Level 2 practices are required.
protocolAdvantage: High yield of total RNA (typical yield: 5-15 µg from 1 ml of human blood)
Preserves small RNA species including microRNAs
protocolLimitation: Not recommended for samples stored in heparin
Requires careful handling of toxic TRIzol reagent
Processing time sensitive - samples should not be stored in TRIzol for extended periods

step.name: Sample Preparation
step.text:
1. Add 1 ml of TRIzol reagent to 100-200 µl of whole blood in a sterile 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube.
2. Vortex thoroughly for 30 seconds to ensure complete cell lysis.

step.name: Phase Separation
step.text:
1. Add 0.2 ml of chloroform per 1 ml of TRIzol.
2. Shake tubes vigorously for 15 seconds.
3. Incubate at room temperature for 3 minutes.
4. Centrifuge at 12,000 × g for 15 minutes at 4°C.

step.name: RNA Precipitation
step.text:
1. Transfer the aqueous phase to a new tube.
2. Add 0.5 ml of isopropanol.
3. Incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes.
4. Centrifuge at 12,000 × g for 10 minutes at 4°C.

step.name: RNA Wash
step.text:
1. Remove supernatant.
2. Wash RNA pellet with 1 ml of 75% ethanol.
3. Centrifuge at 7,500 × g for 5 minutes at 4°C.

step.name: RNA Resuspension and Quality Control
step.text:
1. Air-dry RNA pellet for 5-10 minutes.
2. Resuspend in 50 µl RNase-free water.
3. Measure concentration and quality using NanoDrop (A260/280 ratio should be >1.8).

protocolOutcome.name: Expected Results
protocolOutcome.text: Purified total RNA with A260/280 ratio >1.8 and concentration of 50-150 ng/µl. RNA integrity number (RIN) should be >7.0 for high-quality samples.

citation.name: Johnson et al. (2025) Optimized RNA isolation from human blood samples for transcriptome analysis
